rules.description: For office visits, use POS 11; common modifiers: 25 when significant, separately identifiable E/M service on the same day.
Ensure diagnosis pointers map to clinical reason for each service line; at least one pointer required per service line.
If prior-auth is known required, include priorAuthRefNumber; otherwise omit.
PLACEHOLDER ONLY: Example that some high-cost cardiology imaging may require prior auth. REPLACE WITH REAL PAYER DATA BEFORE PROD.
PLACEHOLDER ONLY: Example that modifier 59 or XS may be required for distinct procedural services. REPLACE WITH REAL PAYER DATA BEFORE PROD.
PLACEHOLDER ONLY: Example that PT/OT may have visit frequency limits (e.g., 60/year). REPLACE WITH REAL PAYER DATA BEFORE PROD.
PLACEHOLDER ONLY: Some elective surgeries may require prior auth. REPLACE WITH REAL UHC DATA BEFORE PROD.
PLACEHOLDER ONLY: Certain dental codes may bundle and disallow modifier 59; verify separable services. REPLACE WITH REAL PAYER DATA BEFORE PROD.
PLACEHOLDER ONLY: DX↔CPT compatibility is required; ensure submitted diagnoses justify procedures. REPLACE WITH REAL DATA BEFORE PROD.

NCCI 2024: 97110 + 97140 are bundled unless performed on separate anatomic sites or distinct 15-min intervals; if distinct, append modifier 59 or XS on the secondary code (often 97140) with documentation of separation.
Medicare: 97110 covered when medically necessary and on an individualized plan with measurable functional goals, progress notes, and qualified PT supervision.
UHC: Elective surgeries may require prior authorization depending on plan; verify current PA list and document indication. If PA not required, note policy/date; if required, include auth number.
